== Setting things up ==
<pre>
$ sudo apt-get install bzr-builddeb
$ bzr whoami "James Westby <james.westby@ubuntu.com>"
$ bzr launchpad-login james-w
</pre>

== Making a simple change ==
# <nowiki>[[#Setup|Set up]]</nowiki> your environment as explained above.
# <pre>
$ bzr checkout lp:ubuntu/karmic/gedit</pre>
1. <pre>
$ cd gedit
$ vi debian/rules
$ dch -i</pre>
1. <pre>
$ bzr bd -- -S</pre>
# Do test-building and testing of your changes.
# <pre>
$ debcommit -r</pre>
1. <pre>
dput gedit_*_source.changes</pre>

== Updating a package to a new Upstream version ==
<nowiki>[[#Setup|Set up]]</nowiki> your environment as explained above.
1. <pre>
$ bzr checkout lp:ubuntu/karmic/gedit</pre>
1. <pre>
$ cd gedit
$ bzr bd -- -S</pre>
1. <pre>
$ uscan
$ dch -i</pre>
# Do more necessary changes.
# <pre>
$ bzr bd -- -S</pre>
# Do test-building and testing of your changes.
# <pre>
$ debcommit -r</pre>
1. <pre>
dput gedit_*_source.changes</pre>

== Proposing a merge ==
<nowiki>[[#Setup|Set up]]</nowiki> your environment as explained above.
1. <pre>
$ bzr checkout lp:ubuntu/karmic/gedit
$ bzr branch gedit gedit-fix123456</pre>
1. <pre>
$ cd gedit-fix123456
$ vi debian/rules
$ dch -i</pre>
1. <pre>
$ bzr bd -- -S</pre>
# Do test-building and testing of your changes.
# `debcommit` will figure out if you used `(LP: #123456)` in `debian/changelog` and attach the branch to the bugs. <pre>
$ debcommit
$ bzr push lp:~james-w/ubuntu/karmic/gedit/fix123456</pre>
